sub_topic: Determining the degree sequence of a graph.
message_1: Consider a simple undirected graph with 6 vertices. Determine a possible degree sequence for this graph.
message_2: A possible degree sequence for a simple undirected graph with 6 vertices is (5, 4, 3, 2, 1, 0). This means that one vertex has a degree of 5 (connected to all other vertices), one vertex has a degree of 4 (connected to four other vertices), one vertex has a degree of 3 (connected to three other vertices), one vertex has a degree of 2 (connected to two other vertices), one vertex has a degree of 1 (connected to one other vertex), and one vertex has a degree of 0 (not connected to any other vertices).
